short_summary: Aftercare Psychology Services for Windsor Parole Office. Provide 140 hours of psychological services to CSC within a year.
description: This contract is for the provision of post-custody psychology services for the Correctional Service of Canada (CSC), for the Comtohs Business Location in the Windsor area, to provide essential and non-essential mental health services to eligible offenders who are nearing or have reached the end of their sentence, for a total of 140 hours/year. Service Provider shall provide proof of qualifications and membdership of professional body, proof of pracitce as psycholoist, Level of proficiency required in English language; qualification requirments, etc.
full_summary:
================================
**Psychology Services Tender Announcement**

**Reference:** cb-9151-38700279
**Solicitation Number:** 21470-27-4312147/A
**Publication Date:** September 15, 2023
**Tender Closing Date:** September 20, 2023 (14:00:00 hours)
**Expected Contract Start Date:** October 1, 2023
**Expected Contract End Date:** September 30, 2026

The Correctional Services Canada is seeking to contract unauthorized providers for aftercare psychology services at the Windsor Parole Office.

**Services to be Provided:**

The selected provider will provide essential and non-essential mental health and/or psychological assessment and risk assessment services to offenders as specified by the Project Authority. The services will be delivered from the provider's business location in the Windsor area, Ontario region, or other CSC-approved locations.

**Objectives:**

* To provide evidence-based psychological assessment and treatment services as a registered psychologist in Ontario for a maximum of 140 hours per year.
* To address the offender's motivation for the index offense and reduce the risk of reoffending.
* To prioritize the amelioration of the offender's mental health and emotional or behaviorally functioning, including feelings, attitudes, beliefs, and behaviors.

**Evaluation Criteria:**

The bid will be evaluated based on the bid submission, which must include a description of the proposed services, the qualifications of the provider, and the methodology for delivering the services.

**Security Requirements:**

* The contract will include security requirements.
* The provider must hold a Criminal Record Check (CRC) and a Positive Defense Screening (PDS) as part of the security clearance process.

**Timeframe and Delivery:**

* The contract period is from October 1, 2023, to September 30, 2026, with the option to renew for two additional one-year periods.
* The provider must submit reports as per the client's requirements and recommendation.

**Note to Bidders:**

* Bidders can download the solicitation document and associated documents from the Buy and Sell - Tenders website.
* The Crown reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
* The documents may be submitted in either English or French, and the bidders may request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation process within 15 working days of receipt of the results.

To submit an application, please visit [the Canada Buys website](https://canadabuys.canada.ca
